security: This report details intelligence gathered from a Cuban source (LITAMIL-9) regarding Cuban Embassy personnel in Mexico City, potential security risks, and Cuban diplomatic activities, including information on the planned body search of a Mexican national. Sharing this information could compromise the source, expose intelligence-gathering methods, and strain diplomatic relations. For example, the document states: "Cubans plan to conduct a full body search of FAR LAS when she leaves Cuba, i.e. 'en cueros'. I-9 pointed out that FARIAS is a Mexican and if it true what MAIZ reporting about body search etal it would be good for PP play in Mexico."
summary: A contact report from Mexico City details information provided by LITAMIL-9 regarding Cuban Embassy personnel, potential security breaches, and diplomatic activities, including planned actions against a Mexican national.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret contact report from the Chief of Station in Mexico City summarizes information provided by the source LITAMIL-9 during meetings in May 1963 concerning the activities of Cuban Embassy personnel and other individuals. The report includes details on potential security risks involving Cuban diplomats, suspicions about individuals connected to the embassy, planned actions against a Mexican national named FARIAS, and information on travel plans and political views shared by various contacts. The information was gathered at pre-arranged meeting points outside of Mexico City to prevent security breaches.
title: Contact Report/ LITAMIL-901
recipient: Chief, SAS; Chief of Base, Merida; Chief of Station, WAVE; Chief, WHD
